body:
> If I switch to the latest version, I get an error building sqlsessionFactory, ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67118112/138240758-fecffab6-bfe7-4d1a-9c9b-fae5f29fabbe.png)

Regarding the error of `sqlsessionFactory`, I think you should check the configuration of mybatis.
It is more recommended that you use the latest version, and you can refer to `ModuloHintShardingAlgorithm.java` and `META-INF/services/org.apache.shardingsphere.sharding.spi.ShardingAlgorithm`in the example
Could you add test cases for your code?
@xfzhaoGit I have tried `SELECT FROM_UNIXTIME(1447430881)` in 4.1.1 and master branch, all supported.

select * from demo where create_date > from_unix(1234567890) and create_date < from_unix(1447430881)   
create_ date is used as the partition key

> Could you add test cases for your code?

There are other important things this month, so I will do it in the future

@marker-wu Thank you for your feedback, this is not a bug. When two sharding tables are not configured with a binding table relationship, the federation execution engine will be used, and the logical sql will not be rewritten at this time.
@LeeGuoPing Welcome, I just assign this issue to you.
@LeeGuoPing Of course, this issue is yours now.

> > ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45256940/138251277-a7f37919-12a4-4d14-96f2-29edd83194a5.png)


@marker-wu  That is not the data source host, it is the client address.

Verify on MySQL backend proxy.

Part of sharding configuration:
```
  shardingAlgorithms:
    database_inline:
      props:
        algorithm-expression: ds_${user_id % 3}
      type: INLINE
    t_order_inline:
      props:
        algorithm-expression: t_order_${order_id % 2}
      type: INLINE
```

I did a test on PostgreSQL backend proxy too.
With customized `bit_xor` and `crc32` function for PostgreSQL.

Part of sharding configuration:
```
  shardingAlgorithms:
    database_inline:
      props:
        algorithm-expression: ds_0
      type: INLINE
    t_order_inline:
      props:
        algorithm-expression: t_order_${user_id % 2}
      type: INLINE
```

proxy result:
```
sharding_db=> select bit_xor(crc32(concat_ws('#',order_id,user_id,status))) from t_order;
  bit_xor
------------
 3473013800
(1 row)
```

On sharding tables result:
```
scaling1=# select bit_xor(crc32(concat_ws('#',order_id,user_id,status))) from t_order_0;
  bit_xor
------------
 2385496147
(1 row)

scaling1=# select bit_xor(crc32(concat_ws('#',order_id,user_id,status))) from t_order_1;
  bit_xor
------------
 1093547131
(1 row)

scaling1=# select int8xor(2385496147,1093547131);
  int8xor
------------
 3473013800
(1 row)
```

Each final result is `3473013800`, matched.

More test on PostgreSQL backend proxy.

On empty data source, return empty result, the same as on sharding table:
```
sharding_db=> delete from t_order;
DELETE 6
sharding_db=> select bit_xor(crc32(concat_ws('#',order_id,user_id,status))) from t_order;
 bit_xor
---------

(1 row)

scaling1=# select bit_xor(crc32(concat_ws('#',order_id,user_id,status))) from t_order_1;
 bit_xor
---------

(1 row)
```

With sub-query:
```
sharding_db=> select bit_xor(crc32(concat_ws('#',order_id,user_id,status))) from (select * from t_order limit 10) as tmp;
ERROR:  Error while preparing statement [select bit_xor(crc32(concat_ws('#',order_id,user_id,status))) from (select * from t_order limit 10) as tmp]
```

> @roodkcab It looks like `MySQLXARecoverStatement` has not been handled. This could cause non-consistent data when the transaction manager is doing the crash recovery. Also you skip the `XAEnd` and `XAPrepare`, and I think this could not be compatiable with XA protocol.

```XAEnd``` and ```XAPrepare``` is handled by ShardingSphereTransactionManager(Atomikos), which should be skipped here. For broadcasting sqls to backend database, I think it's better to implement jdbc and proxy in the same way.

> I wonder that there is any problem if we just broacast the XA related statements to the backend databases ?

Yes shardingsphere reports Failed to switch schema, please terminate current transaction, I did a step by step trace and found shardingsphere is trying to execute XA statement on every schema defined in conf.

> @roodkcab It looks like `MySQLXARecoverStatement` has not been handled. 

Right, I'm thinking of sending it to backend database directly.

> Yes shardingsphere reports Failed to switch schema, please terminate current transaction, I did a step by step trace and found shardingsphere is trying to execute XA statement on every schema defined in conf.

OK, I think this could a bug on shardingsphere. The XA statment should execute on all of the backend databases as the following Sql after xa_begin might be re-written and execute on different backend databases. Can you point out the codes which report the failures ? I can take a close look.

Thanks !
